post_text:
Message from Superintendent

The decision to close school or call a two-hour delay is always a difficult one and is always taken very seriously. This morning, at a late hour, I was notified that a Lisbon and Landaff school bus were off the road and several roads were not passable due to trees being down in the road. Many failed attempts were made to contact the Lisbon Highway Department to discuss the situation. Lack of cell service always makes those communications a challenge. Given the information I was provided, I had no choice but to call the two hour delay. I apologize for the inconvenience of the late call.

Pierre Couture
Superintendent
text:
Message from Superintendent

The decision to close school or call a two-hour delay is always a difficult one and is always taken very seriously. This morning, at a late hour, I was notified that a Lisbon and Landaff school bus were off the road and several roads were not passable due to trees being down in the road. Many failed attempts were made to contact the Lisbon Highway Department to discuss the situation. Lack of cell service always makes those communications a challenge. Given the information I was provided, I had no choice but to call the two hour delay. I apologize for the inconvenience of the late call.

Pierre Couture
Superintendent

Biddy basketball sign ups will be Thursday, November 8th from 6-7pm in the gym lobby at the school. Sign ups will be for the following age groups: Pre-K (ages 3-4), grades K-2, grades 3-4 and grades 5-6. Teams will be finalized following sign ups. Schedules will be released ASAP.

Any parents interested in coaching please contact Sam Natti.

post_text:
FREE Clothing Give Away ONE DAY ONLY
Geared more to benefit area students K-12 but all are welcome!

Saturday, November 17th 10am - 2pm
Lisbon town hall, Lisbon NH

We are accepting donations to help the students in our area. To date we have received
a wide range of clothing, but we need more donations for our students.
BIGGEST PRIORITY IS COLD WEATHER CLOTHING:
Coats
Hats
Mittens/Gloves
Ski Pants
Winter Boots
SweatShirts
Pants
General Winter/Warm Clothing

We are also accepting any other clothing to give away to anyone who could use them and adults are welcome!
All clothes that have been donated so far are in good, like new condition.

Please help us in the sorting process by donating only clothes that are NOT stained,
NOT ripped or torn, NO frayed edges and in OVERALL GOOD CLEAN CONDITION.

For donations, contact Phyllis Robinson
Email: pidnckrobinson@yahoo.com

This will also be on Facebook so feel free to message Phyllis Robinson through messenger on Facebook

post_text: The Middle School Student Council is conducting a food drive next week to benefit the local community. The food drive will start Monday, October 29th and will end Thursday, November 8th. Students should bring in their non-perishable food items to their homeroom teachers. Items will be sorted and counted at 11:30am on Thursday, November 8th. Thanksgiving food items such as: pumpkin pie filling, stuffing, canned veggies, evaporated milk, and cranberry sauce will be worth two points and all other food items will be worth one point. The homeroom that has the most points will win a Dunkin Donuts party.

post_text:
Welcome back high school students!

Your summer reading papers are due to your English teachers (regardless of which semester you are taking English) BY Sept. 7th.

This is a summative assignment, so please don't "skip" it or be late with it! (In fact, early is better!) If you have misplaced the guidelines for the paper, it is still posted on the main page of the school's website.

A replacement triple slide will be installed at the Lisbon School playground tomorrow, August 28th. Thank you

post_text:
6th Grade Letter!
July 18, 2018

Dear Parents,
We hope you are having a great summer and are looking forward to the start of a new school year. We wanted to write and once again give you a little information about your child‚Äôs classes this fall. The fifth and sixth grade rooms are still located at the end of the hallway past the main office.
Your child‚Äôs survival list for the upcoming year includes:
- an assignment book or planner
- one, 2-inch binder
- four, 3-hole punched folders (1 each of red, blue, green, and yellow)
- one, 3-subject notebook
- pencils
- 1 or 2 highlighters
- markers or crayons and other art supplies you might like to use other than what is supplied.
Enjoy the rest of the summer.
Tara Landry
Rebecca MacKenzie A. J. McVetty Sandra Roberts

post_text:
4th Grade Letter!

Hello 4th Graders, August 2018

My name is Ms. Marro (rhymes with tomorrow) and I will be your new 4th grade teacher at Lisbon Regional School! I am so excited to meet all of my students and become a part of this wonderful community!
I hope you are having a fantastic summer! I definitely am, but busy getting our classroom ready! On the back of this letter you will find a list of supplies, if possible, needed for the classroom.
A little about me: I am a graduate of Granite State College with a Bachelor of Arts degree and a dual certification in both Elementary Education (K-6) and General Special Education. This is my second year teaching at Lisbon Regional School and I cannot wait for all of us to be together for the upcoming school year!
I would like to get to know a little bit about each of my students before the start of school on August 27th. Please feel free to send me an email at: almarr@lisbon.k12.nh.us and let me know something about you.
I can‚Äôt wait to meet each and every one of you!
Love,
Ms. Marro

post_text:
Mrs. Hartwell's 3rd Grade Letter!

August 2018

I hope you‚Äôve been having a great summer! I‚Äôve been busy enjoying the sunshine! I hope you‚Äôre getting excited about school and are ready for a fun year of learning.
To help our class run smoothly, you will need the following things for the year:
o a pair of scissors (with your name on them)
o 2 or 3 regular pencils with erasers
o a pencil box
o 2 glue sticks
o a set of 8 colored pencils
o and if possible, a container of Lysol/Clorox wipes and a box of tissues to donate to the class (to wipe down desks and door knobs)
PLEASE do NOT bring any binder or folders of any sort because you will not have the extra room in your desk.
Enjoy the rest of your summer, play outside, and read a book in the sunshine if you‚Äôre bored! I will meet you outside on the first day of school!
From,
Mrs. Hartwell ÔÅä
arhart@lisbon.k12.nh.us

post_text:
Notice from SAU 35

The Berlin School Board is hosting a school-funding forum on Thursday September 6, 2018 at 6pm.

The forum will be held at the Berlin Middle School in the Middle School Auditorium. The event will be conducted by Andru Volinsky, current Executive Councilor and former lead attorney in the Claremont lawsuit and Attorney John Tobin, a partner in the Claremont lawsuit.

post_text:
3rd Grade parents

I hope you‚Äôve been having a great summer! I‚Äôve been busy enjoying the sunshine, kayaking, reading lots of books, vacationing in North Carolina, and visiting with my family from New York. I hope you‚Äôre getting excited about school and are ready for a fun year of learning.

I have purchased Student Planners for each of you to help keep track of your daily assignments. To help our class run smoothly, you will need the following things for the year:

a pair of scissors (with your name on them)

2 or 3 regular pencils with erasers

a pencil box

2 glue sticks

a set of 8 colored pencils

and if possible, a container of Lysol/Clorox wipes and a box of tissues to donate to the class (to wipe down desks and door knobs)

PLEASE do NOT bring any Trapper Keepers, binders, etc. of any sort because you will not have the extra room in your desk.

Enjoy the rest of your summer, play outside, and read a book in the sunshine if you‚Äôre bored! I will meet you outside on the first day of school!

From,

Mrs. Grady

post_text:
**4th grade parents
Hello, August 2017

My name is Ms. Marro (rhymes with tomorrow) and I will be your new 4th grade teacher at Lisbon Regional School! I am so excited to meet all of my students and become a part of this wonderful community!
I hope you are having a fantastic summer! I definitely am, but busy getting our classroom ready! I will be sending out a school supplies list very soon with items you will need for the classroom.
A little about me: I am a graduate of Granite State College with a Bachelor of Arts degree and a dual certification in both Elementary Education (K-6) and General Special Education. For the past four years I have worked with students at the Elementary School in Franconia, NH and I am so excited to have my own classroom at Lisbon Regional School!
I would like to get to know a little bit about each of my students before the start of school on August 28th. Please feel free to send me an email at: almarr@lisbon.k12.nh.us and let me know something about you.
I can‚Äôt wait to meet each and every one of you!
Love,
Ms. Marro

Mrs Gadapee's Classes:

Both College Composition (Juniors) and American Lit (Seniors) are also Running Start classes; college credits can be earned as a dual credit option. Information about costs, scholarships, and how to register for RS will be given out at the start of school, or parents/students can contact Mrs Gadapee via email. All students should have a dedicated notebook, blue or black ink pens, and a thumb drive available each day.
